page.title: 07Housing South of Oakley 1
page.content: In addition to modern developments similar to those at Kempshott (see previous page), there are older properties in Oakley such as{Railway {Terrace}in Hill Road which was built for railway workers in mid-1800's. Now these are modernised, privately owned and selling for around Â£38,000. Just before the 1939-45 War, a lady living in one of these houses was not able to raise the Â£50 to buy it, being asked by the Railway Company. In{St. {John's Road,}bungalows built before 1940 are being extended and modernised by the new owners. The most select area for houses is along{Pardown}where the larger plots and more rural outlook makes these detached yet older dwellings more sought after. They are mainly of post- war comstruction built 1958 - 1983. Prices range from Â£60,000 to Â£120,000.
